intro: Kadua glaucifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf kadua, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glaucous, waxy leaves that give it a silvery appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Kadua glaucifolia is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native environment.
